theme.name: Maker
theme.description: Teams on the Akron bus will be working on businesses targeting the Internet of Things and the Maker movement.  Unlike other buses the Akron bus will have lots of hardware hacking and building of actual physical prototypes.

mentors.name: Chris Bue
mentors.bio: Nerdy girl embroiled in torrid love affair with her Roomba. Makes spreadsheets. Runs MakerBiz Chicago. Conductor of 2015 @StartupBusMAKE.

mentors.name: Christopher Laco
mentors.bio: Sr. Mgr, Software Development @Rackspace. Co Founder of @Wastebits. 3 time bus alumni with a StartupBus tattoo. Perl lover. Ruby on Rails rider. Musician.

mentors.name: Gordon Schorr
mentors.bio: Senior Fellow, University of Akron Research Foundation. Guerrilla Entrepreneur without borders; connecting natural and logical partners to make others successful.

conductors.name: Will Yaworsky
conductors.bio: Adding things to the internet one toaster at a time.

conductors.name: Ray Lewis
conductors.bio: Co-founded Wastebits on the 2012 StartupBus out of Las Vegas.  Since then Wastebits as Ray have been especially dedicated to giving back to the community that started it all: StartupBus.

conductors.name: Arianna Pacheco
conductors.bio: @ariannapacheco Business Designer @Brodmann52, Chief Get Shit Done Officer @Dev.f, the biggest hacker School in Latam. Startup Enthusiast, Girl in tech evangelist, Wannabe Foodie ;)

conductors.name: Daniel Yubi
conductors.bio: Product Manager @Payclip, Co-founder of Local-e & Crafting Mexico. I love bringing concepts to reality. Just a crazy guy working on crazy projects.

theme.name: Social Impact
theme.description: Teams from the Vancouver bus will be working with Social Impact as their theme. Basically, we want our buspreneurs to be building some kickass products and services that solve real-world social, cultural or environmental issues. So if you want to save the world, hop on the Vancouver bus!

conductors.name: Rui Da Costa
conductors.bio: Rui is a UX developer in Rochester, NY who loves the web, his family, and ultimate frisbee.

conductors.name: Theresa Hines
conductors.bio: Theresa is a UX/UI designer in St. Louis, MO who loves optimizing digital experiences, craft beer, and anything outdoors.

theme.name: Transportation
theme.description: The transportation revolution is underway. No matter what time it is or where you're located, youâ€™re minutes away from a ride. People are taking cars off the road by carpooling at the push of a button. And a new workforce of drivers is powering on-demand delivery. You can build the next great business on top of platforms like Uber, and in the process make getting from Point A to Point B more pleasant and productive. Hop in.

conductors.name: Giovanni Barbieri
conductors.bio: Hustler filling @StartupHouse with bootstrapping entrepreneurs. Former #firefighter with @acffiorentina blood in my veins. It might be contagious.

conductors.name: Prateek Gupta
conductors.bio: Developer Content @Pluralsight, ex-COO @airpair, SF Conductor @TheStartupBus, @DEMO Alumni, entrepreneur, traveler, foodie, and the family guy!

mentors.name: Bill Brister
mentors.bio: challenging the status quo - disrupting the normal everyday - we all have a purpose

mentors.name: Keit Kollo
mentors.bio: Passionate to the last pixel combining free spirit and love for technology. UX @WeavMusic & Director @theStartupBus Europe

mentors.name: Andrew Noonan
mentors.bio: Developer Platform @uber. Formerly @asana, @Twitter & @Gnip. Skier. Mnt Biker. Is there WiFi on this plane?

conductors.name: Justin Davis
conductors.bio: I help companies make products that rock. Co-founder and design at First Chair Partners. Creator of @gojampay. Also, bourbon.

conductors.name: Ashley Mooney
conductors.bio: Integrated Marketing Director in Tampa, FL with a  penchant for caffeine, cats and conversions.

theme.name: Press and Media
theme.description: How will your startup leverage the many platforms in todays market to create media and get the press they need to succeed? Whether you are a company or personal brand you use press and media to reach your clientele. Snapchat, Instagram, Twitter, Periscope & Facebook each allow us to produce and share media to generate press and gain exposure. New York City is not only a media hub but a city that relies on the press for information. The New York City bus will look at the way the press and media are used today and work to establish the platforms of tomorrow.

conductors.name: Laura Cartagena
conductors.bio: Producer at Picture Farm, Founder of Create Collect, creative & dreamer living and working in New York City.
